input.description: XML document conforming to the ConnectionDetails Concept that contains the information required to execute a command.
The name of the new directory.
The permissions mode for the new directory. Not supported in Windows O/S
Create parent directories as needed? Not supported in Windows O/S Valid values: true

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation succeed? Valid values: true

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text>mkdir </xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${permission mode}') !=0 "> <xsl:text>-m ${permission mode} </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${create parent directories}') !=0 and '${create parent directories}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text>-p </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${directory name}') !=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${directory name}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/usr/bin/mkdir </xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${create parent directories}') !=0 and '${create parent directories}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">-p </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${permission mode}') !=0 "> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">-m ${permission mode} </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${directory name}') !=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${directory name}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">mkdir </xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${directory name}') !=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${directory name}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Create Directory Create a new directory at the specified location.
